column5: GALT GALvanizing Alzheimers disease therapy to combat the inflamed brain Leire AbaldeAtristain See all authors and affiliations Science Translational Medicine 08 May 2019
GALT Oh yeah DU this and DU that and stock down 10 from RO Great job POFS Stick to making cardboard and let someone else run this
GALT DU has been fixing his Bulldozer Almost ready to rip
GALT GALT is in Rip Van Winkle mode Hopefully my kids or grandkids will reap the benefits of my foresight and patience

GALT lets see no CMO Management largest shareholder and BOD dumped shares high weak RO no Phase 3 protocol no update on FDA drug or repro tox but all this means a Buy Out For sure because they cant be that Incompetent
GALT Current price is a gift to buyers who are accumulating and averaging down Company is in the strongest position ever and a NASH Phase 3 company wont be trading in the single digits thats for sure

GALT If there was no chance of a buyout 1 BackBay would be gone by now 2 A new CMO and management team would be in place for a Fall P3 start Nothing special came out of ASCO But we did learn some things Like in NASH checkpoint inhibitors wont do the job alone combinations are needed We also learned that checkpoint inhibition has a growing number of toxicities associated with therapy The Galectin 3 science continues to advance We have an inhibitor that is a safe therapy perfect for combination therapy both in NASH and in Immunooncology Good luck
GALT News of any of these could come next week next year or the year after Between next week and next year is most likely Im patient
GALT Being concerned about share price in the absence of news about effectiveness partnership or buyout makes no sense if you believe in the science and are in for the long term as I am
GALT Now down over 5 with no real bottom in sight

GALT I love it when these ICPT clowns come to the GALT board to boast about their overpriced ass itching drug that costs an arm and a leg Maybe I should just sell my liver to pay for the cost of Ocaliva The idiocy Congrats on the drug generating income yes fantastic but now you need to put on your business hat and think about how an insurance company can possibly entertain the outrageous costs associated with the infamous ass itching killer the manufacturing costs are too high and so are the drug costs Regardless of saving lives and treating the ill it is all about business and always will be Good luck with that battle 20k for three month supply Ill stick to my apple juice thats cheap to manufacture and does not make my ass itch Keep coming Ocaliva wrong board

VKTX GALT Does anyone know anything about IMRN they have drugs in phase 2 for NASH Just did financing and is 60 off 52 wk high Definitely a micro cap but im thinking about getting in at the ground floor
